intro: Euxolus deflexus var. major, commonly known as the Greater Flexuous Euxolus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is known for its aromatic foliage. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
